str2: Comparative degree of ano; upper, i.e. to a more conspicuous place, in a former part of the book.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Abstr. and concr: sacrifice; a sacrifice, offering. From thuo; sacrifice.
An offering, sacrifice. From prosphero; presentation; concretely, an oblation or sacrifice.
A whole burnt offering. From a derivative of a compound of holos and a derivative of kaio; a wholly-consumed sacrifice.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To be well-pleased, think it good, be resolved. From eu and dokeo; to think well of, i.e. Approve; specially, to approbate.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
